availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David E. Moss, Sr. (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Mercer County, Kentucky, native. Married to Dorcus E. Hicks Moss in Green County, Kentucky, on July 2, 1817. Father of Francis J. Moss, George T. Moss, Mary E. Moss, David U. Moss, William G. Moss, and Charles W. Moss. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Owned Elizabeth [Unknown] in Green County in 1856. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Green County in 1860.
